meanings.definition: Used to express anger or frustration.
meanings.sent1: Dammit! I can't find my keys anywhere.
meanings.sent2: Oh, dammit! I spilled my drink on the carpet.
meanings.sent3: Dammit, I forgot to set my alarm and now I'm late for work.
meanings.sent4: Her constant nagging was like a dammit echoing in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the car alarm going off was a loud dammit in the quiet neighborhood.

meanings.definition: An exclamation of annoyance or irritation.
meanings.sent1: Dammit! I dropped my phone again.
meanings.sent2: Hey, dammit! Stop cutting in line.
meanings.sent3: Dammit, why does it always rain on my day off?
meanings.sent4: The constant buzzing of the mosquito was like a dammit in my ear.
meanings.sent5: The screeching brakes of the bus were a loud dammit in the busy street.
